name: Hotel-Motel Castel de la Mer

reviews.text: We were 6 adults on a motorcycle trip around the Gaspe and spent our first night on the road here. The new suites are exactly like the photos and were clean with hardwood floors, flat screen TV, mini kitchen and King bed. The showers were great and for an additional $4.00 there was a buffet breakfast that was not elaborate but certainly adequate and much better than normally found at chain hotels. This is very reasonable and comfortable accommodations in an expensive area. There are many nearby restaurants and bars all with in walking distance and the St Lawrance is across the street. There is no real river view except by foot.
reviews.title: Clean and reasonable

reviews.text: In a search for reasonably priced accommodation in Charlevoix, I chose this property based on the favourable reviews on TripAdvisor. We were most definitely not disappointed! The room was very clean and a good size (with two Queen beds, a table and chairs, and a little balcony), the beds were very comfortable, and the staff at reception were extremely helpful in answering questions about the area. We opted for the least expensive 'standard' room, and were completely satisfied. Although this block of rooms faces the main road (route 362), which could be noisy from the balcony, the view of the bay was lovely and we did not find the noise bothersome at night. My only real complaint was that our supposed nonsmoking room had an ashtray in one of the drawers. A nonsmoking portion of a hotel/motel should be just that, in my opinion.
reviews.title: A great little motel in an expensive region

likes.liked: — Value, location, cleanliness, comfort, helpful staff
likes.disliked: — Nonsmoking room that may not always be nonsmoking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, however, there was little with which to find fault for this motel. The location is also great - La Malbaie (Pointe au Pic) is a convenient access point to exploring Charlevoix, and the motel itself is steps away from several restaurants and a nice walking path along the bay. We were very pleased with this little find.
reviews.title: Great value in an expensive town

reviews.text: Thanks to reviews on Tripadvisor, we booked a room at this lovely hotel/motel. The guy at the front desk was very welcoming and our room was just what we needed after a long drive : immaculately clean, spacious and comfortable, with coffee-making facilities, fridge etc. We encountered no problems with noise of any sort, and the breakfast in the morning was quite simply one of the best for quality/price I have encountered anywhere (apart from the coffee which was as watery as most places in Canada)
reviews.title: Great stay ! Rapport Qualité Prix Imbattable

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights and used the hotel as a base to travel round the area and go whale-watching. You really don't need to go any further or search among the over-priced chintzy B&Bs to find a real sense of welcome and hospitality : it's all here !
reviews.title: Would go back in a heartbeat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Un grand merci au Motel Castel de la Mer pour la gentillesse de leur accueil et un rapport qualité/prix imbattable. Chambre spacieuse, confortable et très propre, petit-déjeuner excellent, emplacement idéal pour rayonner dans la région.
reviews.title: Very Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We (a group of 6 friends) stayed there July 14. We stayed in 2 rooms equipped with 2 queen size beds. You may ask for a cot ($10 extra) lif can't share a bed with s/one else : ) Rooms were spacious, had a balcony, bath tub, shower, mini-coffee maker and hair dryer. Generous continental breakfast cost $4. extra per person, well worth it: cereals, 3 kinds of bread which you could either toast or grill, garnishes (including yummy 'cretons'), hard-boiled eggs, mini-muffins, juice, coffee. Conveniently located. Good service, very satisfied with everything: spark clean, roomy and just plain pleasant.
reviews.title: A Bargain

description: Overlooking the St. Lawrence River, less than a kilometre from the casino, 28 very spacious air conditioned rooms with a small refrigerator, private balcony and high-speed Internet connection. Huge terrace with a view of the river. Whether you are attracted by its fabulous location or incredible value for the dollar, let Le Castel de la Mer help make your next stay in Charlevoix the most pleasant and relaxing ever.
